description:
Dial in your Facecam settings like a pro.


What’s new in Camera Hub 2.1?
Camera Hub 2.1 adds support for our newly released Facecam 4K, and introduces Nintendo Switch 2 compatibility for Facecam Neo, Facecam MK.2, and Facecam 4K. Also included in this update are quality-of-life improvements across LUTs, backgrounds, and Prompter.
⚠️ Important Note: Camera Hub 2.1 now requires macOS 13.3 or later.

🌟 Facecam 4K joins the lineup
Launching with Camera Hub 2.1, Facecam 4K is our most powerful webcam yet—delivering uncompressed 4K60 video, full manual control, and cinematic effects. It also supports industry-standard 49 mm lens filters, so you can shape light, control reflections, or add creative flair just like on a DSLR.

🔗 Learn more about Facecam 4K
🎥 Watch our Facecam 4K overview

🎮 Switch 2 support for Facecam 4K, Neo and MK.2
Facecam 4K, Facecam MK.2, and Facecam Neo are now all compatible with Nintendo Switch 2. Just update your firmware and you’re good to go.
Pro Tip: Be sure to save your settings in Camera Hub so they carry over when using your camera with Switch 2.

- 🔗 How to update Facecam 4K
- 🔗 How to update Facecam Neo
- 🔗 How to update Facecam MK.2

🌈 Tint Control for Facecam MK.2
With the latest firmware installed, Facecam MK.2 now supports Tint adjustments, giving you more control over your video color.

🎨 Smarter LUT previews
Camera Hub now shows more detail when hovering over a LUT, including a larger visual preview, LUT name, description, and author. The default intensity is now set to 50% for a more balanced starting point.

🖼️ Import multiple LUTs or AI Backgrounds
Now you can import several at once, whether from your own collection or Marketplace, making it not only easier but also quicker to add new looks to Camera Hub.

💡 Improved Prompter controls on macOS
You can now control Prompter display settings directly in Camera Hub.
- Adjust contrast
- Turn the display off completely

🛠️ General improvements and bug fixes
- Fixed a startup crash on Windows with certain GPUs
- Camera Hub now stays in focus after downloading LUTs or Backgrounds from Marketplace

What's new in Camera Hub 2.1.1
- Fixed an issue preventing Twitch Chat from working as a Prompter source due to recent platform updates by Twitch.

Want to share feedback on Camera Hub 2.1.1? Connect with us:
- Leave a comment on our Subreddit
- Chat with fellow community members on Discord
- Hit up @elgato on Twitter
- Contact our Support Team
